(a)   Find the radius of convergence of the power series for <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b)   Use the first three terms in the power series for <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to approximate the value of <math alttext="f of negative 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Use the alternating series error bound to show that <math alttext="f of negative 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> cannot equal <math alttext="the negative of the fraction 2 over 25"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c)   Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function satisfying <math alttext="g of 0, equals 3"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of x, equals f of x"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Write the first three nonzero terms and the general term of the power series for <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(d)   For the function <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined in part (c), find the value of <math alttext="g of negative 2"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, or explain why it does not exist.
